intro: Struthanthus harlingianus, commonly known as the Harling's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a perennial species that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Struthanthus harlingianus is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus.
